channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Signage at junction of Rochester Road and Rochester Place, 11th February
item.description:
Completely inappropriate and unnecessary signage blocking the footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Rochester Road, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of Bin bags teared open, Fly Tip, 11th February
item.description:
This case has been escalated to the local councillor. There has been bin bags dumped near Norman Road, its the grass verge area near Belvedere park development. These bin bags have been sitting there for weeks now, and have been teared open by either rodents or people, please could we get this cleaned up as it is now a hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yarnton Way, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge potholes, 11th February
item.description:
There are numerous potholes that are the whole way from Shooter’s Hill to welling high street on both sides of the road all over. This has caused damage to my tyres which I have had to spend a lot of money on to get new ones as it has taken chunks of rubber out of them. The entire road needs to be resurfaced as this is one of the main routes connecting towns and is used by all different kinds of vehicles such as cars buses and Lorries. Please can this road be resurfaced.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bellegrove Road, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paint discarded by tree, 10th February
item.description:
White paint discarded next to tee and is being spread all over the street
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lilian Close, Hackney, London

item.title: Illegal parking inside residencial complex, 10th February
item.description:
People keep parking their lime bikes inside the complex which attracts outsiders looking to get access to said bikes. This is a residential complex that is cut off from the main road and should only be accessible to the residents. There have been several complains of strangers jumping the gates to get to the bikes
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Menai Place, Bow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath flooded and fence in dangerous condition, 10th February
item.description:
The ditch between the railway and the path is overflowing over the footpath. To get past pedestrians have to sidle along next to a fence behind B&Q which has sharp metal plates sticking out, making it hazardous & difficult to pass.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Plumstead High Street, Plumstead

item.title: 3 large potholes at junction., 10th February
item.description:
Three large potholes at the junction which you cannot miss if turning right into Shepperton. These appear to have been reported in November, marked out for repair so long ago the paint markings have faded, but nothing has been repaired. These must surely be a priority now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nightingale Road, Petts Wood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned road signs, 10th February
item.description:
These roadwork signs were left here months ago when works were happening at the junction of Carysfort road and Clissold crescent. Please can they be collected?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Piano Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose manhole cover, 10th February
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Swingate Lane, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: MASSIVE fly tipping repeatedly on Anglesea mews!!, 10th February
item.description:
Horrible situation over and over again. Massive fly tipping spot, for industrial and construction rubbish also. Cleaning helps temporarily , we need more serious actions being taken, this is a hazard for our neighborhood. Please take action and help us!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Anglesea Avenue, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole and damaged road surface, 10th February
item.description:
There is a pothole and damaged road surface on Picardy Manor way as you approach the roundabout where The Morgan pub is. It is the left hand lane. This has been here for several months and is getting worse everyday. Please repair.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picardy Manorway, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
